review: I tried both this and the stick version, beyond a doubt the ability to hard wire the device is with the extra money. Hard wiring the device also allows for a better streaming experience (less buffering).The one thing that I am less pleased with is the fact that I can not use both devices with in the same house; when I attempted to do so I found that either remote can operate the other device. Even though they were two floors away from each other the devices would not operate independently and thus would not work correctly either..
author: Darrin Hickey

review: I had amazon send me a replacement to my original because it kept turning off randomly (apparently this was a known bug that was corrected in this newer model). Haven't had any issues with this one. The functionality of this is great.I had a flat-screen LCD that was sitting in a closet because it was replaced with our Smart TV. But, it felt like such a waste to let it sit there when there was nothing wrong with it. This Amazon Fire TV coupled with a new TV mount and my TV is now mounted in the study and you would never know it wasn't a Smart TV.  Has all the functionality of our Smart TV plus I feel like I have easier access to games now...and it's way cheaper than a new TV.When I checked on 8-27-15, it looks like amazon has stopped selling this version. I would try the stick version though, considering my success.
